alert.note: Alert for Dunklin; Pemiscot (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:41PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Greene, north central Mississippi, central Clay, west central Pemiscot and Dunklin Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 340 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Rector, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennett, Piggott, Gosnell, Rector, Senath, Marmaduke, Oak Grove Heights, Cardwell, Hornersville, Arbyrd, Lafe, Knobel, Pollard, Greenway, McDougal, Deering, Crockett, Bragg City, Pascola and Nimmons. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for eastern Arkansas...and southeastern Missouri.
